definition: Chinese Civil War, also known as War of Liberation 解放戰爭|解放战争[Jie3 fang4 Zhan4 zheng1]
Guomindang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] and Chinese Communist Party 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3]

sentences.english: KMT-CCP cooperation ensured the War against Japan .
sentences.chinese: 国共合作是抗日战争胜利的根本保证。

sentences.english: The comparison of lasting strategic effects of CPC and KMT.
sentences.chinese: 国共两党持久战略效果之比较。

sentences.english: US Republican congressman David Dreier is in Egypt to observe the elections.
sentences.chinese: 美国共和党议员正在埃及观察这次选举。

sentences.english: CPC and KMT arrived at an agreement to counterattack the Japanese invaders together.
sentences.chinese: 国共两党达成一致共同抵抗日本侵略者。

sentences.english: And all we known, both PRC and ROC gave up Japan, s war reparations.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，国共两党都免除了日本的战争赔款。

sentences.english: War of resistance against aggression wins, country in all battle, does Chinese whereto go?
sentences.chinese: 抗战胜利，国共开战，中国向何处去？

sentences.english: With the development of modern education, and public education concept has changed.
sentences.chinese: 第一次国共合作期间，广州近代教育事业发展迅速。

sentences.english: In addition, both the Communist Party of China and the GMD make an great contribution on the exaltation of the Chinese international position.
sentences.chinese: 国共两党都为中国国际地位的提高做出了重大的贡献。

sentences.english: Huai Hai Campaign was the last major combat between two Chinese political parties.
sentences.chinese: 淮海战役是国共两党所率军队之间最大的战役。

sentences.english: And would he have influenced thebrewing Nationalist/Communist divide?
sentences.chinese: 会对国共两党当时正在酝酿的分裂产生影响吗？

sentences.english: IV. The comparison of lasting strategic effects of CPC and KMT.
sentences.chinese: 国共两党持久战略效果之比较。

sentences.english: John Leighton Stuart was the US Ambassador to China during the Second Civil War between the KMT and the CPC.
sentences.chinese: 司徒雷登在第二次国共内战期间任美国驻华大使。

sentences.english: Japanese wins KMT-CPC cooperation, national self-reliance of the world pass.
sentences.chinese: 国共合作抗日胜，民族自强世界传。

sentences.english: Comintern concession in the compromise policy, the cooperation between the Kuomintang and eventually rupture.
sentences.chinese: 在共产国际妥协退让的政策下，国共合作最终破裂。

definition: Guomindang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] and Chinese Communist Party 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3]
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
Chinese Civil War, also known as War of Liberation 解放戰爭|解放战争[Jie3 fang4 Zhan4 zheng1]
(China's) War of Resistance against Japan (1937-1945)
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Communist Party
Korean War (1950-1953)
nationalist forces
to resist Japan (esp. during WW2)/anti-Japanese (esp. wartime activities)
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Guomindang or Kuomintang (KMT)/Nationalist Party
civil war/internal struggle
Resist US, help North Korea (1950s slogan)
incessant fighting between warlords
Xi'an Incident of 12th December 1936 (kidnap of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4 shi2])
